body:
Hi,
We are attempting to use [Score-P](https://www.vi-hps.org/projects/score-p/) to analyze applications.
To do this the command "scorep" must be appended to all compile and link commands
`
scorep  mpif90 app1.f90 app2.f90 -o app
`
My question is, what is the Spack Way to get this done?
I have successfully done this by editing the package.py and either adding patching the makefile, and/or using the filter_file function to replace "mpif90" with  "scorep mpif90". While this works, it can be a bit tedious and leave room for error.
Any other ways i am not thinking of? Could a custom compiler be defined that adds this automatically?

Thanks,
title: Spack "way" to prefix to all compile and link commands (for profiling)?
